Articles.Content:
I've been using FAR for some time now but I am still confused about the static analysis. Is there a simple guide somewhere that says that a number is red you should add more wing/control/more lift front or back and so on. Please, oh good Kerbal comunity, help me. My planes do fly but on some designs it is a constant struggle to keep it from flipping or loosing control.

Edited February 2, 2016 by Mighty1

https://youtu.be/tWrPZtWqKg4
and related videos of the same author, as well as FAR wiki docs (sparse, but complete):

https://github.com/ferram4/Ferram-Aerospace-Research/wiki/Static-Analysis-with-FAR
https://github.com/ferram4/Ferram-Aerospace-Research/wiki/Definition-of-Terms-and-Symbols

flying manually in 2016...

The "Notes on Stability Derivatives" is also informative.

Generally I will run the analysis, then change something, and see how it changes the numbers.
I will check the links you posted Boris. Thank you.
